intro: Pteroxygonum denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed pteroxygonum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
